text: BJP MLA Munirathna and six others are accused of sexual harassment in Ramnagar, Karnataka, with an FIR filed under multiple IPC sections. Currently in Bengaluru police custody for allegedly threatening a contractor, his bail plea is set for today. Further allegations include death threats and extortion involving a BBMP contractor.
title: 'Raped me for 2 years ... ': Woman files complaint against Karnataka BJP MLA Muniratna Naidu

text: India and France mark 60 years of space collaboration, with significant projects like the upcoming Trishna satellite mission and cooperation on Gaganyaan. Both nations are working closely on various space activities, sharing expertise and resources to address global challenges and future human spaceflight missions.
title: Wish India & France 600 years more of success: French space chief
Nazara Technologies to raise $108 million from SBI Mutual Fund, others
Land acquisition hurdles threaten satellite township projects
Keonics probe uncovers Rs 120 crore worth bogus works
Democracy Day’s 2,500km human chain earns spot in Book of World Records
Film City inches closer to reality as Siddaramaiah directs KIADB to transfer land

text: Karnataka made history with a 2,500-kilometer human chain involving 25 lakh participants to celebrate the International Day of Democracy. Organized by the Social Welfare Department, this event emphasised unity and democratic values. Collaboration between government entities, civil society groups, and NGOs played a crucial role in its success.
title: Historic 2,500-Km human chain in Karnataka earns spot in world records for Democracy day

text: Bengaluru-based Bellatrix Aerospace has unveiled Project 200, a satellite designed to operate in Ultra-Low Earth Orbit at altitudes of 180-250 km. This innovative satellite aims to reduce communication latency, improve image resolution, and lower costs. The project was launched at the Bengaluru Space Expo by IN-SPACe chairman Pawan Goenka.
title: Bellatrix Aerospace unveils groundbreaking ultra-low earth orbit satellite

text: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, surged in trade on Friday to hit lifetime highs following a more than expected 50 basis points rate cut by the US Federal Reserve.
title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex hits fresh lifetime high, goes above 83,600; Nifty50 above 25,550
Meerut Metro: India’s ‘Fastest’ Metro Service Unveiled! Check Top 10 Features, Stations, Route & More

text: Wall Street stocks experienced a slight decline after the Federal Reserve announced an unexpected half-percentage-point interest rate cut. Fed Chair Jerome Powell emphasized a careful approach to further cuts while noting progress in reducing inflation. Major US stock indices saw minor losses, with the Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq Composite all falling.
title: US stocks dip despite larger Fed interest rate cut

text: Star India has filed a claim for $940 million in damages against Zee Entertainment Enterprises in the London arbitral court due to payment defaults on cricket broadcasting rights. The arbitration process is ongoing, with Zee refuting the claims and planning to contest them, asserting that Star breached the agreement first.
title: Star seeks $940 million from Zee over failed cricket deal

text: Anna Sebastian Perayil's death at EY in Pune has led to calls for better employee well-being in India Inc. HR leaders emphasize the need for improved work-life balance. This incident follows another case of a young professional's death due to work pressure, highlighting growing concerns over workplace stress and management practices.
title: EY staffer's death puts focus on work stress
SpiceJet's 3,000-cr QIP oversubscribed

text: The US Federal Reserve has lowered its benchmark interest rate by half a percentage point to bolster the labour market. The new rate range is now 4.75% to 5%. Further cuts are expected in 2024 and 2025 as policymakers balance inflation and employment goals amid rising economic uncertainties.
title: In first cut in 4 years, US Fed slashes rates by larger 50bps

text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has unveiled NPS Vatsalya, a new pension scheme designed for minors to foster long-term financial security. The initiative was simultaneously launched at 75 locations across India, distributing over 250 PRANs to young subscribers. The scheme aims to instill saving habits early and leverage compounding for substantial future wealth.
title: Starting early: Pension a/cs for children
Amazon veteran Samir Kumar is new India head

text: The US Federal Reserve's decision to cut rates by 50 basis points is unlikely to prompt an immediate reaction from RBI. This move could help stabilize the rupee and lower borrowing costs. Experts have mixed opinions on its impact, with some seeing benefits for NBFCs while others remain cautious about broader economic effects.
title: RBI's pause may continue, Dalal Street to tread cautiously

text: Tupperware's Indian operations remain stable despite the US-based parent company's Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing. Local manufacturing supports this stability, and recent festive season sales have surged. The company aims to evolve into a digital-first, technology-led enterprise while continuing to provide innovative products through consultants, retail partners, and online platforms.
title: US bankruptcy may not hit Tupperware India

text: EY Restructuring has resigned from advising Pankaj Srivastava, the NCLT-appointed internal resolution professional at Byju's. This development follows BDO’s resignation as Byju’s auditor earlier this month. Srivastava is currently inviting lenders, employees, vendors, and government entities to claim unpaid dues. Representatives from the IRP, EY, and Byju’s have not responded to queries.
title: EY resigns as adviser to Byju's IRP

text: Wall Street hovers near record highs as the Federal Reserve initiates a significant interest rate cut to stave off a recession. The S&P 500 remains nearly unchanged, with slight movements in the Dow Jones and Nasdaq. The Fed aims to support the slowing economy and job market while carefully managing inflation risks.
title: Wall Street holds near records after Fed delivers a big cut to rates

text: The US Federal Reserve has lowered interest rates by 50 basis points, marking its first cut in over four years. This action is likely to increase foreign investment in India, influence the Indian Rupee, and benefit sectors like IT and consumer goods. The RBI's response will be key to maintaining financial stability.
title: US Fed cuts interest rates by 50 bps in a first since 2020: Why it matters for India

text: Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman dissented on an interest-rate decision for the first time since 2005, opposing a 50 basis point cut in favor of a quarter-point reduction. Her stance reflects concerns about easing too quickly and highlights ongoing internal debates within the Fed over monetary policy amidst economic challenges.
title: Michelle Bowman's dissent is first from Fed Governor since 2005

text: US Federal Reserve Meeting: The US Federal Reserve has cut interest rates by 50 basis points, the first reduction in over four years, aiming to reverse restrictive economic conditions. Policymakers expect further rate cuts, targeting a range of 4.25%-4.50% by year-end as inflation nears the 2% goal and unemployment rises.
title: US Federal Reserve cuts interest rates by 50 bps in key FOMC meet chaired by Jerome Powell

text: Pfizer Inc has inaugurated its first commercial analytics centre in Mumbai, India. This global capability centre will serve Pfizer's international markets outside the US, employing data analytics and AI to improve patient outcomes. The initiative is part of Pfizer’s strategy to modernize marketing and boost sales effectiveness across 140 international markets.
title: Pfizer sets up global capability centre in India

text: SpiceJet's Rs 3,000-crore qualified institutional placement has been significantly oversubscribed by investors including Tata Mutual Fund and Bandhan Bank. This demonstrates strong confidence in the airline's growth potential. The funds will help unground its fleet and settle employee dues, reflecting belief in India's expanding aviation market.
title: SpiceJet Rs 3,000-cr QIP oversubscribed; airline to get funding soon

text: Tupperware Brands has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection due to declining sales and financial challenges. The company will seek court approval for a sale process and intends to maintain operations during the proceedings.
title: Why has the iconic Tupperware Brands filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy?

text: NPS Vatsalya launch today: Nirmala Sitharaman, Union Minister for Finance and Corporate Affairs, has launched the NPS Vatsalya scheme today. This initiative focuses on securing children's financial future through a pension account.
title: NPS Vatsalya: FM Nirmala Sitharaman launches National Pension Scheme variant for children; check details

text: The Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption (DVAC) has charged former AIADMK minister S P Velumani and ten Greater Chennai Corporation officials with corruption over storm water drain and road work tenders from 2018. Allegations include manipulated tender processes, resulting in a ₹26.61 crore loss to the government, with irregularities like bid collusion and inflated rates.
tags: Directorate of Vigilance and Anti - Corruption
title: SWD, road tender graft: DVAC books SP Velumani, 10 corporation officials

text: Relatives and friends of Puzhal Central Prison inmates are using innovative methods to smuggle drugs. Recent incidents revealed drug tablets concealed in date seeds and a ganja sachet stitched into trousers. Authorities have registered cases against those involved, including Balaji, Dinesh Kumar, Karthikeyan, and Praveen, as investigations continue.
title: 4 booked for sneaking ganja, drugs into prison in Tamil Nadu

text: In Chennai, J Pavithran, a 19-year-old food delivery executive and Bcom student, took his own life after being scolded by a woman customer for late grocery delivery. He left a note expressing his dejection. Police are investigating the incident and any actions taken by the delivery company following the customer's complaint.
title: Scolded by customer for being late, Chennai food delivery executive ends life

text: J Pavithran, a 19-year-old part-time food delivery executive and Bcom student from Kolathur, took his own life after being scolded by a woman customer over a delayed grocery delivery. The incident led to police involvement when he retaliated by damaging her property. An investigation is currently underway.
title: Chennai's food delivery boy dies by suicide
Civic body claims sewage flow into Koramangala valley down to 8 MLD

text: At Bengaluru's Jnanabharathi Metro station, security staffer Rashmi saved a man's life by stopping an approaching train after he jumped onto the tracks. Her quick thinking minimized service disruption to just 15 minutes. This incident underscores the importance of emergency training and earned her commendation from both officials and passengers for her swift action.
title: Swift move: Alert security staffer stops Metro train, saves man who jumped on track in Bengaluru
4 Karnataka youths win medals of excellence at global skills event
Tender coconut shells posing health risk on Old Airport Rd

text: BJP president BY Vijayendra addresses criticism from senior colleagues like Ramesh Jarkiholi, stressing his goal of securing a clear majority for the party in the next assembly elections. Proudly identifying as BS Yediyurappa's son, he underscores Karnataka's importance for BJP's southern ambitions while dismissing claims of arrogance.
title: Swallowing barbs to ensure BJP's win in Karnataka: BY Vijayendra
Road rage a violent blend of traffic anger & intolerance: Police
In resolution, state urges Centre to release ₹5k crore for Kalyana Karnataka
Diabetic foot cases rise, delayed checks could end in limb loss: Doctors
Govt worried about Muda case verdict, neglecting law & order: BJP
New PG norms: BBMP extends deadline, likely to relax rules

text: Panic ensued in Electronics City, Bengaluru, after a leopard was seen crossing Hosur Road towards NTTF grounds early Tuesday morning. Forest officials confirmed the sighting and deployed a Leopard Task Force for combing operations. Previous leopard sightings in the area have raised concerns among residents and prompted heightened vigilance.
title: Leopard in Bengaluru's Electronics City: Where is it hiding?
Role of PFI will be examined: Parameshwara
Rs 1.6k cr to convert Kalaburagi into smart city

text: In Bengaluru's Byadarahalli area, five women pourakarmikas were allegedly abused and assaulted by a mother-son duo after refusing to clear a large pile of garbage. The incident resulted in injuries and led to an FIR being filed under multiple sections, including the SC and ST (Prevention of Atrocity) Amendment Ordinance-2014.
title: Ugly turn to trash row: Mom, son assault 5 pourakarmikas in Bengaluru

text: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, were in red in early morning opening trade on Wednesday, trading flat ahead of the US Federal Reserve meet later in the day.
title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex, Nifty50 flat ahead of key US Fed meeting

text: The Federal Reserve is anticipated to reduce interest rates this week after keeping them at a two-decade high. While most forecasters expect a quarter-point cut, some believe a half-point reduction is possible. The decision will be revealed on Wednesday, with further insights from Fed Chair Jerome Powell. Economists are divided on whether and how policymakers would signal future cuts in the statement.
title: US Fed to kick off rate cuts, signal next steps

text: Investors in India are moving away from stocks expected to benefit from Prime Minister Modi’s re-election, focusing instead on defensive sectors like consumer and software. Policy reversals and coalition dynamics have introduced uncertainty, causing infrastructure-related stocks to lag. This shift is driven by market volatility and election outcomes. Foreign funds have also turned net sellers in sectors like utilities, cement, metals and financials in August.
title: Traders shy away from Modi stocks in shift to defensives

text: Ford is planning a return to India by exploring the light commercial vehicle and pick-up segment, including both internal combustion and electric options. The company is considering partnerships, potentially with Volkswagen, and has submitted a letter of intent to the Tamil Nadu government for using its Maraimalainagar plant for export manufacturing. A final decision is expected in December.
title: Ford may look at LCVs in India

text: Despite inflation, entry-level salaries in the IT sector have stayed around Rs 3-4 lakh for over a decade. In contrast, Global Capability Centres (GCCs) offer higher pay, with some roles earning over Rs 8 lakh annually. GCCs focus on quality and strategic alignment, attracting talent from premier institutions.
title: GCCs offer higher salaries to freshers

text: Anirudh Devgan, CEO of Cadence Design, emphasizes India's strides in the semiconductor sector. He recommends prioritizing incentives for product companies creating intellectual property within India over manufacturing investments alone. This approach is expected to generate greater wealth and employment opportunities by harnessing India's existing chip design talent for both local and global markets.
title: India must build its own chip design cos: Cadence
WPI inflation eases to a 4-month low

text: SpiceJet has admitted not paying about Rs 220 crore in TDS deducted from employees' salaries and over Rs 135.3 crore in PF between April 2020 and August 2023. The airline seeks to raise Rs 3,000 crore by the end of the month to stay afloat and reactivate its grounded fleet.
title: Didn't pay over Rs 350 crore in TDS & PF, admits SpiceJet

text: India's trade deficit nearly reached a record high in August with total imports rising to $64.4 billion due to a surge in gold shipments, while exports fell to $34.7 billion. Commerce Secretary Sunil Barthwal attributed this increase to higher prices and festival season stocking, considering these figures normal for an emerging market economy.
title: Trade deficit close to all-time high, thanks to record imports

text: The National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA) has suggested updating an outdated accounting standard to align with global norms, focusing on listed private companies. This proposal aims to safeguard investors by addressing multiple accounting lapses. Despite resistance from auditors, NFRA stresses the importance of modern standards given today's complex financial systems and increasing retail investor participation.
title: New audit norms planned to check frauds

text: Subhadra Yojana in Odisha provides women with Rs 10,000 annually in Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC). Launched by PM Narendra Modi, the scheme ensures direct deposits into beneficiaries' bank accounts without intermediaries. Linked to RBI's digital currency pilot, the digital rupee can be spent using UPI QR codes or transferred to bank accounts.
title: Subhadra first govt scheme to offer digital rupee payment

text: Snap Inc introduced its fifth-generation AR spectacles at the Snap Partner Summit in Los Angeles. These lightweight glasses feature a new OS, hand gesture controls, and virtual console capabilities. Initially available to developers for $99 monthly, they promise advanced AR experiences with partnerships including OpenAI, Lego Games, and Niantic.
title: AR glasses are here: Snap launches spectacles at LA summit and its own OS to power it

text: KRN Heat Exchanger and Refrigeration Ltd, headquartered in Rajasthan, will launch its IPO from September 25 to 27. Proceeds will fund a new manufacturing facility in Neemrana. Anchor investor bidding starts on September 24 for one day. The company specializes in fin and tube-type heat exchangers and has partnerships with major industry players.
tags: KRN Heat Exchanger and Refrigeration Ltd
title: KRN Heat Exchanger to launch IPO on September 25

text: Benchmark Sensex rose by nearly 91 points to close at a fresh lifetime high of 83,080. Nifty also settled above the 25,400 level for the first time. Gains were seen in firms like Bharti Airtel and ICICI Bank amid firm global trends ahead of the anticipated US Fed's decision on interest rates.
title: Sensex closes above 83,000 for 1st time
UPS vs NPS Calculator: Is A Switch From National Pension Scheme to Unified Pension Scheme Really A No-Brainer? Check Calculations, Benefits - Top Points

text: India's IPO market has bucked global trends by capturing a quarter of global IPO volumes in the first half of 2024. The country now leads with over 5,450 mainboard listed companies. This growth is driven by strong demand and domestic inflows across sectors like consumer products, industrial products, financial services, and healthcare.
title: India accounted for 25% of global IPOs in first half of 2024: Angel One Wealth

text: Amazon Business has experienced a customer base expansion at a CAGR of 111% over the last six years in India, with 65% of orders made through mobile phones. Notable growth has occurred outside metro areas, especially in Bhopal. A study reveals strong consumer enthusiasm for online festive shopping, with 71% planning to shop online.
title: Amazon Business customer base grew at 111% rate in 6 years: Mitranjan Bhaduri

text: PN Gadgil Jewellers plans to expand its presence in Maharashtra by opening 12 new stores by fiscal 2026. The company raised Rs 1,100 crore through an IPO for this purpose and to retire debt. PNG's flagship store in Pune remains the top revenue generator with Rs 800 crore in sales.
title: Expanding jewels in Maharashtra's heart: PN Gadgil

text: JBM Ecolife Mobility has obtained $100 million in strategic funding from the Asian Development Bank and the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank. This investment will facilitate the supply and operation of electric buses across several Indian states under the Gross Cost Contract model, aiding India's Net Zero 2070 target by promoting sustainable public transport.
title: JBM Ecolife Mobility secures $100 million funding from ADB, AIIB for electric bus expansion

text: Stock market today: Indian equity indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 remained close to record highs with limited movement as investors awaited the U.S. Federal Reserve's interest rate decision.
title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex, Nifty50 hold near record highs ahead of US Fed policy decision

text: IIT Madras researchers have created a portable scanner named POCUS to enhance injury assessment in sports. This AI-driven device scans body parts to differentiate between inflammation and muscle tears, assisting coaches and physios in tailoring training regimes. The working prototype is set for testing with sports authorities soon.
title: IIT-Madras develops scanner for sports injuries on field

text: Tamil Nadu is proposing measures to combat online gaming addiction by setting time and cash limits, enforcing a night ban, and requiring Aadhaar verification. A survey showed children playing games at night on their parents' phones. Meanwhile, an illegal dumpyard in Chennai's Foreshore Estate has resulted in rising anti-social activities and worsening local conditions.
title: Tamil Nadu moots night ban, deposit caps to rein in online gaming addiction

text: During DMK's diamond jubilee event, Tamil Nadu chief minister M K Stalin called on party cadres to ensure a resounding victory in the 2026 assembly election. He highlighted plans to amend the Constitution for state financial rights and criticized the central government for not providing adequate funds, emphasizing DMK's commitment to federal rights.
title: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin gives clarion call to DMK cadres to ensure big victory in 2026 election

text: Gangster 'Kakkathope' Balaji, involved in over 40 criminal cases including extortion and murder, was killed by police near Vyasarpadi Jeeva railway station. When police tried to arrest him, he opened fire, prompting officers to open fire. Balaji was declared dead at Government Stanley Hospital. He had significant control over parts of north Chennai.
title: Wanted in over 40 cases, gangster 'Kakkathope' Balaji gunned down in police encounter in Tamil Nadu

text: A 66-year-old man named Panneerselvam was discovered dead in the parking area of a Pondy Bazaar lodge. Initially thought to have died naturally, his daughter Vana Roja noticed bloodstains and informed police. CCTV footage revealed he had been run over by a reversing car driven by Aditya Raj Singh, who fled but was later arrested.
title: Man found dead in Chennai market; just before funeral, CCTV shows he was run over by car
Trans identity no ground to deny admission: Madras HC

text: The Madras High Court has decided not to dismiss a criminal case against Jaiswal Products from Delhi, whose banned tobacco items were seized in Tamil Nadu. The court emphasized that the manufacturer is responsible for explaining how their product reached the state and dismissed claims that it doesn't fall under 'food' regulations.
title: Manufacturer of banned tobacco products must ace action, rules Madras high court

text: Kanniyammal, a 70-year-old woman from Bommarajapuram village near Kalpakkam, was discovered murdered at her home on Monday night with her throat slit. Two sovereigns of gold jewellery were reported missing. Police have initiated an investigation, questioning neighbours and examining recent visitors to identify suspects involved in the murder.
title: 70-year-old woman murdered in Kalpakkam, gold jewellery missing

text: Kerur police in Bagalkot district have registered an FIR against 21 individuals following a complaint from Arjun Madar, a Dalit man who was allegedly assaulted for entering Dyamavva temple. Six suspects are currently in custody. Authorities are urging the community to maintain peace and harmony while the investigation continues.
title: Dalit man thrashed for entering temple in Karnataka, 6 held

text: In a recent police raid at Bengaluru Central Prison, authorities seized mobile phones, cash, and other banned items. The operation followed a viral photo showing actor Darshan with rowdy-sheeters inside the prison. Consequently, twelve prison officers were suspended, and Darshan was transferred to another facility. The incident underscores persistent corruption issues in the prison.
title: Renukaswamy murder: 15 phones, knives and omelette stoves found in Bengaluru prison where actor Darshan was 'relaxing' in viral photo
E-khata mandatory for all Bangalore Development Authority properties now

text: In Bengaluru, police arrested a private bus driver after CCTV footage showed he unknowingly ran over a man sleeping on the road. The victim, a 45-year-old daily-wage worker named Srinivasaiah, was found dead with his head crushed. Blood traces on the bus wheel confirmed the incident, leading to the driver's arrest and release on bail.
title: In Bengaluru, bus driver unknowingly runs over man asleep near wheel
Shivakumar amazed by NY’s sky deck, hopes to build something similar in B’luru
Nagamangala violence: No evidence of PFI involvement, says govt
25 lakh form human chain spanningentire Karnataka to celebrate democracy
Tax conclave: Govt invites CM’s of BJP states too
CM champions ‘pluralism’ to defeat divisive forces

text: Excessive rainfall has already caused a spike in vegetable prices, and now Karnataka is preparing for a potential increase in milk prices for the second time in three months. A proposal recommends a Rs 5 per litre hike to support farmers, pending approval from Chief Minister Siddaramaiah.
title: Milk price set to rise by Rs 2-3/litre again in Karnataka

text: Union minister HD Kumaraswamy has alleged that CM Siddaramaiah illegally took over a site allocated to a disabled Dalit by Mysore Urban Development Authority, built a house on it, and later sold it to evade legal troubles. The Karnataka high court is currently considering related allegations against Siddaramaiah involving illegal allotment of sites.
title: HD Kumaraswamy: CM built house on Muda site given to Dalit

text: Bajaj Housing Finance shares commenced trading at Rs 150 on both BSE and NSE, over double the issue price of Rs 70. The IPO raised Rs 6,560 crore and was subscribed nearly 67 times. This strong debut indicates investor confidence in the company's prospects within a growing home loan market.
title: Bajaj Housing Finance's stellar stock market debut: IPO listed with 114% premium at Rs150

text: Stock markets edged up slightly on Monday as investors awaited the Fed rate cut announcement later this week. The Nifty 50 index started at 25,406.65 points with a gain of 0.2 per cent, while the BSE Sensex rose by 0.11 per cent to reach 82,985.33 points.
title: Stock market today: Sensex climbs over 250 points to 83,140.76; Nifty up 74 points to 25,430.60 in early trade
Temasek eyes 20% stake in visa co VFS

text: Tata Group's IHCL, managing Taj Hotels, has reached a market cap of Rs 1 lakh crore, making it the first Indian hospitality company to do so. Oberoi Hotels is valued at Rs 24,000 crore. The Indian tourism sector is poised for significant growth due to government-led infrastructure development initiatives.
title: Taj 1st desi hotel co to top Rs 1 lakh crore mcap

text: International air travel between India and the rest of the world has seen a significant rise in direct flights. In 2023, India's international air traffic neared pre-Covid levels with more passengers opting for non-stop journeys. Indian hubs gained indirect passengers as Middle Eastern hubs lost traffic. Indian airlines introduced many new international routes.
title: More people now fly direct to & from India

text: Kenya Electricity Transmission has awarded Adani Group and Africa50 a public-private partnership to construct high-voltage power lines worth $1.3 billion without needing loans. However, many Kenyans are angered by another proposal granting Adani Group a 30-year concession to manage the country's largest airport, leading to protests from aviation workers.
title: Adani, African Development Bank get $1.3 billion sops for Kenya project

text: Dalal Street investors are eagerly awaiting the US Federal Reserve’s Sept 18 meeting, which could influence global markets. The Bank of Japan’s interest rate decision and Bajaj Housing Finance’s listing will also impact market sentiment. Investors are also anticipating WPI numbers and several IPOs in the coming week.
title: D-St to track US Fed’s rate decision this week

text: A legal battle among PRS 'Biki' Oberoi's children has reached the Delhi high court, which issued an interim order to prevent share transfers in EIH and its holding companies. The dispute involves control over substantial holdings in EIH and a family villa, with allegations that some family members are obstructing the execution of PRS Oberoi's will.
title: Oberoi case: Delhi HC halts transfer of EIH shares

text: Baba Kalyani and his younger brother Gaurishankar are engaged in a legal dispute over their late mother Sulochana's will. Baba seeks to probate a 2012 will, while Gaurishankar presents another from 2022. The case involves significant assets, including properties and shares in the Kalyani Group, with a court hearing expected next month.
title: Kalyani brothers spar over mother's wills in fresh feud

text: Nine of India's top-10 most valued companies collectively added Rs 2,01,552.69 crore to their market valuation last week, with Bharti Airtel emerging as the biggest gainer amidst a bullish equity market sentiment. The Sensex surged by 1,707.01 points or 2.10 percent during the week. LIC was the only company among the top-10 to experience a decline in its market cap.
title: Market valuation of nine of the top 10 companies increased by Rs 2.01 lakh crore, Bharti Airtel emerges as top gainer

text: Cathay Cargo, part of Cathay Pacific Airways, is actively discussing with an Indian airline to use its Hong Kong-based cargo terminal, which handles up to 2.7 million tonnes annually. The company aims for net zero carbon emissions by 2050 and is incorporating AI and sustainable practices to improve operational efficiency.
title: Cathay Cargo wants Indian airlines to use its Hong Kong terminal; in talks with one firm

text: Tata Group's Taj Hotels has achieved a market cap of Rs 1 lakh crore, marking it as the first Indian hospitality company to reach this milestone. The post-Covid travel surge is driving this growth, particularly through domestic tourism. IndiGo also reached a significant market cap last June, indicating strong recovery in the travel sector.
title: Travel boom: Taj Hotel market cap crosses Rs 1 lakh crore; first for Indian hospitality

text: India's foreign exchange reserves have climbed to a record USD 689.235 billion, increasing by USD 66 billion this year. The Reserve Bank of India oversees these reserves to ensure market stability and curb rupee depreciation, leading to reduced currency volatility and greater investor confidence in Indian assets.
title: Forex Reserves climbs to an all-time high of $689.24 billion

text: Livpure aims for over 1 million subscriptions in the next four years, focusing on expanding affordable access to clean water across India. The company plans to grow its operations from 26 cities to up to 75 cities and expects a turnover of Rs 900 crore this fiscal year, representing a significant growth of 60% from last year.
title: Livpure aims 10 lakh subscriptions in 4 years: MD Rakesh Kaul

text: The Indian audio devices market has experienced rapid growth, reaching Rs 5,000 crore in offline retail sales by June 2024. According to a GFK report, the Personal Audio segment saw a 61 percent year-over-year volume increase. The demand for high-quality audio products and advancements in sound technologies are key drivers of this growth.
title: India audio device market registers remarkable growth, offline sales reach Rs 5,000 crore: GFK

text: The Reserve Bank of India is set to revamp its currency management infrastructure over the next 4-5 years. This project includes establishing new currency management centres, automating warehouses, and upgrading security systems. The goal is to efficiently meet future cash needs while ensuring safety and contributing to environmental sustainability.
title: RBI plans to revamp currency management infrastructure to cater to future cash needs

text: Chief economic advisor V Anantha Nageswaran highlighted the necessity for banks to adapt to changing customer preferences and market dynamics. During an event by Indian Bank, he emphasized agriculture’s role in economic growth and commended the bank’s MSME Prerana programme. Indian Bank CEO S L Jain acknowledged Nageswaran’s valuable insights on the economy and banking sector.
title: Banks need to adapt to changing customer preferences to remain competitive: CEA Nageswaran

text: An inter-departmental committee is proposed to address the rise of online gaming platforms and ensure regulatory compliance. The GST intelligence wing has acted against 118 domestic entities and identified 658 offshore ones for non-compliance. Legal clarity on a 28 per cent tax rate exists, but enforcement is still difficult.
title: Inter-dept panel may be set up to ensure compliance by online gaming platforms

text: Foreign investors have invested Rs 27,856 crore in Indian stocks during the first two weeks of September due to market resilience and potential US interest rate cuts. This brings their total investment to Rs 70,737 crore for the year. Regulatory reforms and India's positive economic outlook have further boosted investor confidence.
title: Foreign Investors infuse Rs 27,856 crore into equities amid US rate cut expectation

text: Nayara Energy, India's top private fuel retailer, posted a 14.3% rise in Q2 2024 fuel sales due to growing local demand. Most diesel and petrol were sold domestically, cutting exports. Strategic expansion into underserved markets has driven this growth, enhancing mobility and commerce.
title: Nayara Energy sees 14% rise in domestic fuel sales, exports drop

text: BJP functionaries have started criticizing actor-turned-politician Vijay for not wishing on Vinayaka Chaturthi and extending wishes for DMK founder C N Annadurai's birth anniversary. They accuse him of supporting Dravidian politics and await his party's state conference to decide their next steps.
title: BJP now lashes out at actor Vijay for extending wishes for DMK founder C N Annadurai

text: Chennai's Manali area faces flood risks due to breaches in the Kosasthalaiyar river and limited capacity of the Red Hills surplus canal. The Greater Chennai Corporation has urged the water resources department to fix these issues, but repairs remain incomplete, leading to a blame game between the two entities.
title: Manali faces flood risk as WRD yet to fix waterways

text: Ambattur police have apprehended a 29-year-old man named Sudhakar for using a machete to cut his birthday cake on July 31. The incident surfaced after a video went viral last week. Sudhakar, who operates a manpower company, was charged under the Arms Act and is now in judicial custody. He had previously been detained for bike stunts.
title: Chennai man who cut birthday cake with machete held

text: The high court ruled that a person cannot be prosecuted under Section 67B of the IT Act for viewing child porn online. As a result, the proceedings against the man were quashed. The decision has sparked discussions about the interpretation of the law and its implications for similar cases.

text: CPCB's report to NGT compels MCG to halt daily waste dumping at Bandhwari landfill, citing non-compliance with SWM Rules. Local authorities must improve waste management. Residents oppose new dumping sites. The next hearing is on Sept 5.

text: A recent study proposes that time might not be a fundamental aspect of the universe but rather an illusion stemming from quantum entanglement. This new perspective aims to address the inconsistencies between our best theories of the universe, which have hindered the development of a unified "theory of everything." Researchers have suggested that by considering time as a result of quantum entanglement, the mysterious connection between two distant particles, they might solve this long-standing problem. The study, published on May 10 in the journal Physical Review A, explores this idea.
title: Is time an illusion created by quantum entanglement? A new perspective

text: On Aug. 24, 2023, more than three decades after the first confirmation of planets beyond our own solar system, scientists announced the discovery of six new exoplanets, stretching that number to 5,502. From zero exoplanet confirmations to over 5,500 in just a few decades, this new milestone marks another major step in the journey to understand the worlds beyond our solar system.The DiscoveryWith the discovery of six new exoplanets, scientists have tipped the scales and surpassed 5,500 exoplanets found (there are now 5,502 known exoplanets, to be exact).Just about 31 years ago, in 1992, the first exoplanets were confirmed when scientists detected twin planets Poltergeist and Phobetor orbiting the pulsar PSR B1257+12. In March 2022, just last year, scientists celebrated passing 5,000 exoplanets discovered.Key Facts Scientists have discovered six new exoplanets — HD 36384 b, TOI-198 b, TOI-2095 b, TOI-2095 c, TOI-4860 b, and MWC 758 c — this has pushed the total number of confirmed exoplanets discovered to 5,502.
title: Exploring Nasa's latest exoplanet marvels: 6 fascinating discoveries unveiled

text: However, this initial charm fades as relationships progress. Campbell and Stacy Campbell's model of narcissism divides interactions into the "emerging zone" (initial, short-term contexts) and the "enduring zone" (long-term, continuing relationships). In the enduring zone, narcissists exhibit negative behaviors like arrogance and aggression, leading to a decline in their popularity. Narcissists tend to return to the emerging zone to seek the positive social feedback and emotional rush they crave, thus being adept at gaining new friends and social status but poor at maintaining meaningful relationships.
title: Why narcissists are very attractive in the beginning

text: ​Earth is special not only because it has been habitable for millions of years but also because the outer part of Earth also operated geologically for hundred of millions of years -- the tectonic plates on Earth's crust gradually moved, altering the continents and seas. This movement stoked the biological evolution, the researchers say. All these factors happening anywhere else is probably as extreme rarity.
title: Intelligent aliens haven't contacted us yet. The reason is...

text: Security forces in Jammu region are facing challenges due to lack of human and signal intelligence, leading to higher casualties in counter-terror operations. Additional forces and technology deployment are underway to stabilize the situation. Local politics and encrypted communication are complicating efforts to combat terrorism. The Army's shifting of specialised counter-insurgency troops, including the "Uniform Force" of the Rashtriya Rifles, from the region to eastern Ladakh after China's multiple intrusions into eastern Ladakh in May 2020 has led to a major operational and intelligence gap there.

text: European Union (EU) chief Ursula von der Leyen secured another five-year term as president of the European Commission after winning support from EU lawmakers on Thursday. The 720-member European Parliament approved her with 401 votes in favour, 284 against, and 15 abstentions. Von der Leyen needed 361 votes to pass. Her selection comes at the same time as the arrival of recently elected Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, Keir Starmer.
title: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen gets another 5-year term

text: India A clinched a victory over India D by 186 runs in the Duleep Trophy match at Anantapur. Ricky Bhui's century delayed the result, but spinners Shams Mulani and Tanush Kotian sealed the win. AAP will choose a new leader to succeed him, who will address pending policies and form a new council of ministers.

text: Delhi Police have uncovered a 'visa factory' in Tilak Nagar, west Delhi, arresting six individuals and confiscating fraudulent visas and related equipment. The gang reportedly sold between 1,800-2,000 fake visas over five years for Rs 8-10 lakh each. Mastermind Manoj Monga operated the scheme from his residence.

text: With Arvind Kejriwal's sudden resignation, the search for his successor intensifies. Atishi, who handles 13 portfolios, emerges as a strong contender. Other names include Gopal Rai and Saurabh Bharadwaj. Manish Sisodia is not in the running, and Sunita Kejriwal has been excluded. A Scheduled Caste candidate like Rakhi Birla might also be considered.

text: After being released on bail in the excise policy case, Arvind Kejriwal announced his resignation as Delhi's Chief Minister. He called for early elections in November instead of February 2025 and emphasized he would only return to office if deemed honest by the public. The entire cabinet will also resign with him.
title: Kejriwal says he will quit as CM in 2 days, wants aam aadmi's 'honesty certificate'

text: Delhi BJP president Virendra Sachdeva stated that Delhi residents had already delivered their verdict on CM Arvind Kejriwal's arrest during the Lok Sabha elections when AAP lost all seats. He accused Kejriwal of corruption and poor governance, pointing to problems like waterlogging fatalities, electricity surcharges, and non-operational ICU centers in government hospitals.
title: Arvind Kejriwal had no option but to resign: BJP

text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal cannot call for early elections without recommending the dissolution of the assembly. Experts explain that although the Election Commission can hold polls six months early, it cannot act solely on a government's advice. If Kejriwal resigns, his entire government must step down, leading to new elections being scheduled.
title: ‘Dissolution of assembly must for early polls’

text: Delhi Congress president Devender Yadav welcomed Arvind Kejriwal's resignation as CM but criticized the timing, saying it should have happened six months ago. He argued that Kejriwal's tenure led to multiple crises in Delhi and that the Supreme Court had already imposed restrictions on him, making his resignation inevitable.

text: Police have issued a lookout circular for Kunal Chhabra, linked to the murder of Dubai-based entrepreneur Nadir Shah in Delhi. Investigations continue as police seek further leads and evidence.

text: The Delhi Development Authority will commence construction of a sports complex in Dwarka Sector 19B by December. Facilities will be accessible via membership or pay-and-play options, catering to a broad audience.

text: While IIT Hyderabad's NIRF ranking has improved significantly, IIT Bhubaneswar has seen a decline, dropping out of the top 100 institutions. Meanwhile, NIT Rourkela has shown exceptional performance, securing a top 30 ranking in NIRF.
title: IIT Bhubaneswar's NIRF Slide: A Wake-up Call for Odisha's Higher Education

text: The Navodaya Vidyalaya Samiti (NVS) has extended the application deadline for the Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya Selection Test (JNVST) 2024 for Class 6 admission. Eligible candidates can now apply until September 23, 2024. The JNVST will be conducted in two phases: January 18 and April 12, 2025. Candidates must apply for a JNV in their district of study. Required documents include signatures, photographs, and a residence certificate. It's important to note that a candidate can apply for JNVST only once.
title: JNVST 2024 Registration Deadline Extended to September 23 for Class 6 entrance test: Apply Here

text: Seven students from Parala Maharaja Engineering College in Berhampur were expelled from their hostels for violating college rules and code of conduct by engaging in restricted activities. Police were deployed to maintain order on campus following the incident.
title: Seven Students Expelled from Odisha College for Rule Violation

text: This article discusses the significance of the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) in India's higher education landscape. It highlights the challenges faced by Odisha's state public universities and colleges in achieving top NIRF rankings due to factors like funding, faculty, infrastructure, and bureaucratic hurdles. The article proposes strategies to improve NIRF performance, including institutional development plans, state support, faculty development, research focus, student experience, and outreach. It concludes by emphasizing the potential for Odisha's HEIs to achieve top-tier rankings with concerted efforts and strategic implementation.
title: 'Seven varsities in Odisha have potential to be in top 100'

text: The two-day event organized by IIT Bhilai, NIT Raipur, and CSVTU Bhilai focused on the implementation of Multiple Entry and Multiple Exit (MEME) and Academic Bank of Credit (ABC) systems in higher education. The event, which was held under the aegis of AICTE and Shiksha Sanskriti Utthan Nyas, brought together academicians to discuss the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 and its impact on higher education. The event highlighted the challenges and opportunities presented by MEME and ABC, emphasizing the need for institutional collaboration, faculty development, and integration of cultural values and practical knowledge into education.
title: NEP 2020: Experts Explore Challenges and Opportunities for MEME and ABC in Indian Higher Education

text: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has released the tentative schedule for the NEET Super Speciality (NEET SS) exam. text: The Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) has released the final answer key for the Teacher Recruitment Examination (TRE-3) for classes 1-5, held on July 20, 2024. text: Maharashtra schools and educational institutions will be closed on September 18, 2024, in observance of Eid-e-Milad. text: The Australian Government introduced a cap on international student enrollments starting January 1, 2025, limiting new student commencements to 270,000. Temporary Graduate visa holders may be eligible for a 4-year Skills in Demand visa if employed in a skilled job.

text: Scientists traced an unusual seismic signal from last September to a significant landslide in East Greenland's Dickson Fjord. The collapse of a mountain sent part of a glacier into the water, causing a 200-meter-high mega-tsunami that lasted nine days. This incident highlights the influence of climate change on geological phenomena.

text: From late Thursday into early Friday, solar storms are expected to create faint auroras visible in Canada and northern US states including Alaska and Washington. title: Solar storms may cause faint auroras overnight in parts of Northern Hemisphere

text: Thousands have been evacuated in Hanoi due to severe flooding from Typhoon Yagi, which has resulted in 179 deaths and 145 missing across Vietnam. title: Thousands evacuated in Vietnam as Typhoon Yagi causes flooding; over 170 dead

text: Hundreds of people in the Philippines have fled their homes after Kanlaon volcano emitted harmful gases. text: Mozambique has sanctioned Africa's largest mangrove restoration project, with Blue Forest planning to plant 200 million trees over six decades. text: Poland's rivers are suffering from severe drought conditions with the Vistula river in Warsaw expected to hit record-low levels soon. text: A study by IPE Global and Esri India shows that over 85% of Indian districts are vulnerable to extreme climate events like floods, droughts, and cyclones. Key recommendations include establishing a Climate Risk Observatory and an Infrastructure Climate Fund to improve resilience.

text: The European Union's climate change monitoring service reported that the northern hemisphere experienced its hottest summer on record from June to August 2024, surpassing last year's record. text: The Soyuz MS-26 spacecraft launched from Moscow at 7:23 pm, carrying two Russian cosmonauts and one American astronaut to the International Space Station. It transports crew members and essential supplies while serving as an emergency escape pod. The spacecraft consists of three modules designed for living quarters, reentry, and life support systems.

text: SpaceX's Polaris Dawn mission has transported four astronauts to a record distance from Earth since Apollo 11. The crew is set for the first all-private spacewalk. title: 9-year-old raped in front of younger sister in Maharashtra, given Rs 20 to remain silent

text: Kangana Ranaut has sold her Pali Hill bungalow for Rs 32 crore due to financial difficulties from the delayed release of her film 'Emergency'. Purchased for Rs 20.7 crore in 2017, the property was also involved in a legal dispute with the BMC. The film's release has faced censorship and boycott issues.
title: 'Emergency': Kangana Ranaut sells Mumbai bungalow due to the delays in the release of the film

text: AAP MP Swati Maliwal has expressed strong disapproval of Atishi’s appointment as Delhi's new chief minister, citing concerns about national security due to her parents' alleged support for Afzal Guru. This comes after Arvind Kejriwal's resignation, with AAP backing Atishi unanimously. She has previously held important portfolios like finance and education.
title: ‘Dummy CM, sad day for Delhi': AAP MP Swati Maliwal slams Atishi’s appointment as Delhi chief minister

text: In Faisalabad's Champions One-Day Cup, Stallions' captain Mohammad Haris expressed contentment despite a significant loss to the Markhors. The Stallions managed only 105 runs against a target of 231. Haris mentioned that they aimed to test their team's strength by choosing to chase this time around. The Stallions suffered a crushing 126-run defeat to the Markhors.
title: 'Khushi hai ki hum haar gaye': Pakistan's senior player expresses happiness after his team lost by huge margin - WATCH

text: Facing a difficult phase in his cricket career, Pakistan captain Babar Azam shared a faith-based message amid mounting pressure. His poor form since the ICC World Cup in India and recent struggles against Bangladesh have intensified scrutiny. Former skipper Younis Khan advised Babar to draw inspiration from Virat Kohli's journey and focus on performance.
title: 'Prophet Muhammad who taught us to...': Pakistan batter Babar Azam turns to faith amid poor form

text: Ravichandran Ashwin shared insights on India's morale after being bowled out for 36 against Australia in Adelaide during the first Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy 2020-21. Coach Ravi Shastri boosted team spirit with a karaoke session. Under Ajinkya Rahane's leadership, India rebounded to clinch a historic series win, culminating in a victory at The Gabba.
title: Border Gavaskar Trophy: 36 all out! Ravichandran Ashwin reveals what Ravi Shastri did after Team India's historic low

text: In the Asian Champions Trophy final, Pakistan's hockey players expressed support for China as India claimed their fifth title with a narrow 1-0 win over China, thanks to Jugraj Singh's crucial goal. Pakistan secured bronze after defeating Korea 5-2. The Pakistani players' show of solidarity with China added an intriguing element to the event.
title: Pakistan players wave Chinese flag during India-China Asian Champions Trophy final

text: Hundreds of Hezbollah members, including fighters and medical personnel, were severely injured when their communication pagers exploded across Lebanon. Described as the biggest security breach in almost a year of conflict with Israel, ambulances rushed through Beirut's southern suburbs amidst chaos. Ongoing detonations and numerous injuries were reported by local sources.
title: 'Biggest security breach': 1000s of pagers explode across Lebanon, many Hezbollah fighters hurt; 9 dead

text: President Vladimir Putin has introduced a policy urging Russians to have sex during work breaks to combat the nation's declining birth rate. The initiative includes free fertility checks and financial incentives for new mothers. Stricter abortion access and increased divorce fees are also part of the strategy, aiming to reverse the projected population decline by 2050.
title: Russians urged to have sex during work breaks to boost birth rate: Report

text: Police in Ludhiana have arrested Gyaneshwar Sood and Saurabh Madaan for allegedly providing false evidence in a Rs 1.31-crore fraud case involving a gold chhatra donated to the Badrinath shrine. The Sood brothers are accused of not paying the jeweller who made the chhatra and forging documents during the investigation.
title: Rs 1.31 crore gold 'chhatra' offered to Badrinath temple ‘not paid for’

text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal proposed Atishi Marlena as the new leader of AAP's Delhi Legislative Party, making her the candidate for the next chief minister. All party MLAs supported this proposal. Atishi currently manages 13 portfolios and has significantly contributed to the party’s growth and key issues such as the Delhi water dispute.
title: Atishi to be new chief minister of Delhi; national capital gets woman CM after decade

text: Former Indian cricket captain MS Dhoni is currently vacationing in the US and was seen attending an American football game with friends. His friend Hitesh Sanghvi posted images of their trip on Instagram. While Dhoni hinted at IPL retirement last season, Chennai Super Kings are eager to have him play another season by retaining him for the 2025 edition.
title: MS Dhoni vacationing in the US, spotted watching this sport at a stadium - See pics

text: The rift between Swati Maliwal and AAP escalated after Atishi was named CM Kejriwal's successor. Maliwal criticized Atishi, calling her a 'dummy CM' and alleging her parents supported Afzal Guru. AAP leader Dilip Pandey suggested that if Maliwal disagrees with the party, she should resign from Rajya Sabha and seek a BJP ticket.
title: 'If any shame left ... ': AAP slams Swati Maliwal's remark on Atishi, says she should seek RS ticket from BJP

text: At a Delhi event, Usha Uthup confronted Chief Justice DY Chandrachud about his delayed decision on the Kolkata rape-murder case, stressing the global attention on the matter. A video of them singing 'Summer Wine' together also surfaced. Meanwhile, doctors and celebrities nationwide protested for justice for the victim.
title: Usha Uthup meets CJI Chandrachud at an event; asks him about Kolkata rape-murder case verdict: 'Why aren't you in court?'

text: Australia's veteran off-spinner Nathan Lyon is optimistic about reclaiming the Border-Gavaskar Trophy this summer after a decade-long drought. He predicts a 5-0 series win for Australia, while stressing the need for substantial contributions from top-order batsmen like Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne to counter India's strong pace attack led by Jasprit Bumrah.
title: 5-0! Nathan Lyon believes Australia will hammer India to reclaim Border Gavaskar Trophy

text: Diljit Dosanjh's Dil-Luminati tour will soon hit Delhi, causing significant buzz among fans with high pre-sale and resale ticket demand. To address potential online ticket fraud, Delhi Police issued a humorous yet cautionary message on social media, advising fans to avoid unverified links and ensure their purchases are legitimate.
title: Ahead of Diljit Dosanjh’s Dil-Luminati concert, Delhi Police issues online fraud warning in the most hilarious way possible: ‘Paise puse baare soche duniya..’

text: US Congress leaders have condemned the vandalism at BAPS Swaminarayan Mandir in New York's Melville, describing it as an act of bigotry and hate. They urged that the incident be investigated as a hate crime to ensure accountability and prevent future occurrences. The Indian consulate also strongly disapproved of the act.
title: '​​​​Too much hate': US lawmakers react to vandalism at BAPS Swaminarayan Mandir in New York

text: Stree 2, led by Shraddha Kapoor and Rajkummar Rao, has emerged as the sixth biggest film in Indian cinema and the second highest-grossing Hindi film. With collections reaching Rs 557.85 crore, it aims to surpass Shah Rukh Khan's Jawan but faces competition from upcoming releases such as Devara and Jigra.
title: Shraddha Kapoor’s Stree 2 drops by more than 50 % on 5th Monday

text: Three children were killed and six people injured in Dhule district, Maharashtra, after being run over by a tractor trolly carrying a Ganesh idol. The tragedy occurred during a Ganesh immersion procession when an untrained individual took control of the vehicle and lost control. Police have detained both the actual driver and the man who started it.
title: Maharashtra: 3 children crushed under tractor carrying Ganesh idol in Dhule

text: Neeraj Chopra, an acclaimed javelin thrower, reflected on his challenging 2024 season after narrowly missing a title at the Diamond League in Brussels. Despite fracturing his hand during training, he competed and learned significant lessons. Chopra aims to return stronger in 2025, expressing gratitude for his team's support and fans' encouragement.
title: When a European female fan asked Neeraj Chopra his mobile number…

text: The Great Indian Kapil Show is set to return with a new season. In an interview, Sunil Grover discussed Salman Khan's positive reaction to his finale performance mimicking Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan. The show will be available for streaming from September 21st, every Saturday at 8 PM.
title: Exclusive - The Great Indian Kapil Show 2: Sunil Grover shares Salman Khan's reaction to his finale act with Krushna Abhishek where they mimicked SRK-Salman

text: Yashasvi Jaiswal is on the verge of breaking Ajinkya Rahane's record for the most runs by an Indian batter in a single World Test Championship cycle. He has scored 1,028 runs and needs just 132 more to surpass Rahane’s tally of 1,159 runs. India will face Bangladesh in a two-match Test series starting September 19 in Chennai.
title: Yashasvi Jaiswal on brink of World Test Championship milestone, leaving even Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma behind

text: Chetan Bhagat praised Shah Rukh Khan for his respectful behavior towards women, sharing an incident where Khan offered a chair to Bhagat's mother on the sets of 'Om Shanti Om'. Bhagat also noted Khan's good manners, recalling how the actor personally saw him off at his mansion Mannat. He admires Khan as both an actor and a human being.
title: Chetan Bhagat recalls Shah Rukh Khan offering a chair to his mother on the sets of Om Shanti Om: ‘Nobody on the set thought of it’

text: AIUDF MLA Ashraful Hussain ignited controversy by stating that 'Miyas', immigrant Muslims of Bangladeshi origin, would not work in upper Assam unless welcomed respectfully with traditional Assamese symbols. His remarks come amid backlash following a gang rape incident involving minority youths in Nagaon district, leading to labor shortages in industries like brick kilns.
title: 'Red carpet for Miyas': Assam MLA stirs row with remark following gang rape of class 10 student

text: Mumbai-born Saurabh Netravalkar, who once played for India's U-19 team, now plays for the US national cricket team while working as a Senior Software Engineer at Oracle. His dual roles saw him lead the US to an impressive win over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup, balancing his tech career with his love for cricket.
title: Watch: Saurabh Netravalkar explains how he balances work and passion for cricket

text: Marnus Labuschagne is eagerly anticipating his face-off with Mohammed Siraj during the Border Gavaskar Trophy. Their careers have progressed together since meeting at the MRF Academy in 2015-16. Before this series, Siraj will participate in India's Test matches against Bangladesh and New Zealand, which will be crucial for India to maintain their top spot in the World Test Championship.
title: Why Marnus Labuschagne considers his battles with Mohammed Siraj special

text: A recent Unstop study reveals that Gen Z values job satisfaction and work-life balance over high salaries, contrasting with previous generations' focus on financial security. This demographic seeks personal fulfillment, flexible hours, and supportive work environments. Globally, countries like Australia are leading with employee-friendly laws, while in India, traditional long work hours clash with Gen Z’s expectations. Employers must adapt by prioritizing mental health, growth opportunities, and positive company culture to attract and retain this emerging workforce.
title: Beyond Paychecks: Job satisfaction, work-life balance more important than salary for Gen Z workforce

text: Aditi Rao Hydari and Siddharth have married at a historic temple in Wanaparthy. The couple met on the sets of 'Maha Samudram' and got engaged in March 2024 after a three-year courtship. Their combined net worth is about Rs 130 crore, mainly from films and endorsements. They own multiple luxurious homes and high-end cars.
title: Aditi Rao Hydari and Siddharth - With a combined net worth of approx. Rs 130 crores, here’s a look at the newlywed’s financial portfolio

text: Shakira performed at LIV Miami to promote her new single, 'Soltera,' but stopped dancing after spotting someone trying to film up her skirt. In the video, she adjusts her skirt and signals off-screen to stop filming before leaving the stage. LIV Nightclub later clarified that she was asking her own team to cease filming.
title: Shakira hastily leaves stage after she notices a fan inappropriately filming up her skirt: 'I see you'

text: Nawab Malik's son-in-law, Sameer Khan, was critically injured when his SUV driver accidentally accelerated and crashed into him while he waited with his daughter in Kurla, Central Mumbai. The incident left Khan with multiple serious injuries and he is currently in the ICU at Criticare Hospital. Police have detained the driver for further investigation.
title: Maharashtra MLA Nawab Malik's son-in-law critically injured in car accident in Mumbai's Kurla

text: Processions for Lord Ganesh idol immersions began in Mumbai and Maharashtra as the Ganesh Chaturthi festival concluded. Amid tight security, thousands gathered to bid farewell to the idols. Over 24,000 police personnel were deployed, along with extensive safety measures by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation to ensure a smooth event.
title: Ganesh idol immersion processions begin in Mumbai as devotees bid farewell to their favourite deity

text: Congress workers plan statewide protests against Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad after he offered a reward for cutting off Rahul Gandhi's tongue, accusing him of insulting India's reservation system. An FIR has been filed against Gaikwad for criminal intimidation and provocation. State BJP chief distanced the party from his comments.
title: Congress condemns Shiv Sena MLA's 'Rs 11 lakh reward to cut Rahul Gandhi's tongue' remark

text: A five-year-old cow that lost its leg in an accident last year is now adapting to a prosthetic limb at Bai Sakarbai Dinshaw Petit Hospital for Animals in Mumbai. The animal was brought from a shelter in Palghar and is gradually getting used to the new limb, showing promising signs of acceptance according to hospital officials.
tags: Bai Sakarbai Dinshaw Petit Hospital for Animals
title: A leg lost in accident, cow moos on slow and steady with prosthetic limb

text: The Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS) has lifted the ban on the Progressive Students' Forum (PSF) after a review. The institute also revised its honour code, removing restrictions on political discussions. TISS emphasizes fostering a respectful and inclusive environment while maintaining academic integrity.
title: Mumbai: TISS revokes ban on students' outfit, modifies 'controversial' honour code
Work on bridges gains pace to ease Ghodbunder jams
English teachers to undergo skill test after appointment in Maharashtra

text: A Mumbai businessman fell victim to a Rs 2.14 crore investment fraud after being convinced by two women on dating apps to invest in cryptocurrency and foreign exchange. Despite making substantial deposits, he was unable to withdraw his funds. The businessman has lodged an FIR with the Central cyber police station at Worli.
title: Investment fraud: Bizman duped of Rs 2 crore by two women he met on dating apps in Mumbai

text: Sharad Pawar has requested Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde to develop a time-bound action plan for the Maharashtra Public Service Commission exams. With 32 lakh students preparing, delays have led to frustration. Pawar highlighted the urgency of announcing new exam dates and addressing pending results before the assembly elections code of conduct is implemented.
title: Sharad Pawar urges Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde to decide on holding delayed MPSC examinations

text: Teachers chosen for semi-English medium schools in Mumbai will need to pass an English proficiency test post-appointment. This recruitment drive seeks to enhance student enrolment and avert the shutdown of semi-English and Marathi medium schools. The state enforces these tests to ensure high-quality English instruction, overseen by the regional education authority under SCERT.
title: Mumbai: English teachers to undergo skill test after appointment
4,000 railway police personnel out on railway stations for bandobast on Anant Chaturdashi
Complete FYJC admission process soon, colleges urge govt
Major urges youth to join Army
Kodagu villagers meet to address jumbo problem
