Survey finds 116 school dropouts within M’suru city limits
7-yr-old crushed under bullock cart
Sloth bears in S’mogga Zoo get new enclosure
Elaborate arrangements for Ganesha procession in S’mogga
Residents near Harangi dam face problems
Labourers arrested for carrying beef

text: At the Karnataka Examination Authority headquarters in Bengaluru, NEET counselling candidates must submit notarised bonds on specified stamp papers. This requirement has led to local shops charging exorbitant fees, causing frustration among parents and students. Many are calling for an end to these bureaucratic processes.
title: MBBS admissions in Karnataka: Paperwork tires students, shops make a killing

text: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah called for celebrating constitutional pluralism and resisting divisive forces at a human chain event on International Democracy Day. Highlighting India's democratic heritage, he emphasized the importance of economic and social democracy. The event aimed to promote unity with over 2 million participants across Karnataka's 31 districts.
title: On Democracy Day, Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah champions ‘pluralism’ to defeat divisive forces

text: SWR will operate special one-way trains from Mysuru, Bengaluru, and Hubballi to Hazrat Nizamuddin to manage the festive season rush. These trains will run on specific dates in September and will halt at various stations en route. Linen will not be provided in AC coaches.
title: Special trains for festive season: SWR announces one-way services from Mysuru, Bengaluru, and Hubballi

text: Praneeth, a student from Meerpet, Telangana, lost his life by drowning in a lake in Toronto during his birthday celebration with friends. He was there for his Masters degree. His family is appealing to the government for swift repatriation of his remains. Footage shows him enjoying moments before the tragedy.
title: Telangana student drowns in Toronto lake while celebrating birthday

text: Kumar Rocker made his Major League Baseball debut for the Texas Rangers against the Seattle Mariners, becoming the first player of Indian heritage to do so. Despite undergoing Tommy John surgery, he showcased resilience and talent. His parents were present to witness this historic moment, highlighting increasing diversity in American sports.
title: Indian-origin pitcher Kumar Rocker scripts MLB history

text: JK Rowling has condemned Mridul Wadhwa, the former CEO of Edinburgh Rape Crisis Centre, after a report revealed significant failures in safeguarding women-only spaces. Wadhwa resigned following an investigation that found she lacked professional standards. The ERCC board has committed to implementing recommendations to enhance their services and protect women-only spaces.
title: JK Rowling slams Indian-origin trans executive Mridul Wadhwa over rape crisis centre failings: What’s the fallout?

text: Pravin Gordhan, South Africa's former Finance Minister, has died at age 75 from cancer. A key political figure since the nation's democratic transition in 1994, he held numerous important roles. President Cyril Ramaphosa expressed sorrow over his death, commending Gordhan's integrity and service to the country.
title: Indian-origin ex-South African finance minister Pravin Gordhan dies at 75 after battle with cancer

text: Indian diaspora groups held a protest near the UK Parliament in London to raise awareness about Pakistan's state-sponsored terrorism and counter a propaganda event. They highlighted the neglected plight of Kashmiri Hindus and other communities, urging action against Pakistan's destabilizing activities in Jammu and Kashmir, including human rights abuses and terrorism support.
title: Kashmir diaspora condemns Pakistan's state-sponsored terrorism in UK protest

text: Apple introduced its iPhone 16 series at a launch event where Piyush Pratik highlighted the new Camera Control feature. An IIT Delhi alumnus and Stanford MBA graduate, Pratik has a notable career history with Biocon, Bain & Company, InMobi, and InstaFit before joining Apple in 2019. His achievements garnered attention on social media.
title: Who is Piyush Pratik, the IIT-graduate Apple product manager who spoke about Camera Control feature on iPhone 16 series

text: Govindharaj Muthiah, a 44-year-old Indian-origin carpenter in Singapore, has been commissioned to create two handcrafted chairs for Pope Francis' visit. The chairs will be used during inter-religious dialogue sessions. Muthiah completed the project within a month using leftover lumber from temples and mosques, drawing inspiration from 18th-century furniture designs.
title: Pope Francis to use chairs made by Indian-origin man during Singapore visit

text: Lulu Group chairman MA Yusuff Ali is earning praise for his humility after a video showed him stopping to pose for a selfie with a fan. This comes after another viral video where he gifted a luxury watch to an admirer. Ali oversees 256 hypermarkets and malls across the Gulf and India.
title: 'Humble' Indian billionaire stops for selfie with fan in Abu Dhabi mall; internet applauds

text: A 14-year-old boy faces charges for the murder of Bhim Kohli, an 80-year-old British Indian man attacked while walking his dog in Leicester. Kohli died from neck injuries sustained during the assault. Three girls and another boy were also arrested but subsequently released without further police action.
title: Teen charged with murder of British Indian, 80, at Leicester park

text: Sources also claim that the group of young people suspected to be responsible for the horrifying tragedy fled the scene after brutally assaulting him. The victim was left screaming in agony at the scene, his daughter said, according to The Sun.
title: 'Kicked him in the spine': How Indian-origin grandfather Bhim Sen Kohli was tragically beaten to death by children in Leicester
Yoga guru Pradeep Ullal held for raping NRI

text: Shijil, a 40-year-old man recently returned from the United States to Kerala, died in a road accident while traveling home to Thalassery. The incident occurred near Mukkali, Vadakara when the taxi he was in collided head-on with a truck. The taxi driver also succumbed to his injuries. Further details are awaited.
title: Kerala man returning from US, dies in road accident on his way home

text: The Foundation for India and Indian Diaspora Studies (FIIDS) has launched the 'Indo American Votes Matter' campaign to increase the policy impact and participation of Indian-American voters in the upcoming US presidential elections. With around 4.5 million Indo-Americans concentrated in key swing states, their votes could significantly influence election outcomes.
tags: Foundation for India and Indian Diaspora Studies
title: US elections: Campaign launched to increase participation of Indian-Americans in polls

text: Tata AIA Life Insurance has inaugurated an offshore branch at GIFT City, India's first International Financial Services Centre, aimed at offering US dollar denominated life insurance for NRIs. These plans cover various risks and include flexible add-on benefits. Tata AIA also plans to introduce unit linked life insurance products soon.
title: Tata AIA launches US dollar denominated life insurance for Non-Resident Indians

text: Indian students in Canada are facing difficulties due to new policy changes impacting work permits, cost-of-living requirements, and post-graduate work opportunities. Restrictions on open work permits for spouses and caps on international student intake add to the challenges, potentially affecting their residency and career goals in Canada.
title: Will Canada remain an attractive destination for Indian students? Policy changes throw up some challenges

text: A devastating multi-vehicle crash on US route 75 in Anna, Texas, feared to have claimed the lives of four Indian nationals. The accident occurred when a speeding truck rear-ended their SUV, causing it to burst into flames. Authorities are using DNA fingerprinting for identification due to the severity of the fire. Families await confirmation.
title: 4 Indians, including 2 from Hyderabad, killed in fiery multi-vehicle crash in Texas
Many NRIs are disposing of their properties in Andhra Pradesh

text: Jaskirat Kaur, aged 33, has pleaded guilty to the manslaughter of her 10-year-old daughter on grounds of diminished responsibility at Wolverhampton Crown Court. The girl's body was found at their West Midlands home in March. The prosecution accepted Kaur's plea, and sentencing is set for 25 October. The case remains a tragic incident that shocked the community.
title: India-origin mother pleads guilty to killing 10-year-old daughter in UK

text: The FBI is offering a $25,000 reward for information leading to the arrest of Cindy Rodriguez-Singh, accused of murdering her son Noel Alvarez. She was last seen in March 2023 heading to India with her family. Authorities report that Rodriguez-Singh lied about her son's whereabouts, claiming he was living with his father in Mexico.
title: Ties with India: FBI offers $ 25,000 reward for information leading to arrest of Cindy Rodriguez-Singh on her son's murder

text: The IRCC has discontinued its 'temporary' policy that let visitors apply for work permits while in Canada as of August 28. Introduced in August 2020 due to COVID-19, this policy was supposed to end in 2025. The change aims to reduce immigrant numbers ahead of upcoming costs and an election.
title: Visitors can no longer apply for work permits within Canada

text: A partial lunar eclipse named Chandra Grahan is set for September 18, 2024. Visible in North America, Europe, Africa, and South America but not in India due to the Moon being below the horizon. The event can be watched safely with the naked eye or via live streams from NASA and ESA.
title: Will lunar eclipse 2024 be visible in India? Know when, where and how to watch the celestial event

text: Using the James Webb Space Telescope, astronomers have confirmed that supermassive black holes can prevent star formation in their host galaxies by expelling vital gas and dust. An international team led by Cambridge University discovered this phenomenon in a distant galaxy, providing important insights into how black holes influence galaxy evolution and development.
title: James Webb Space Telescope reveals how supermassive black holes starve galaxies of star formation

text: Australia and India are expanding their space collaboration, focusing on supporting India's Gaganyaan mission and launching joint satellites. Australian Space Agency Head Enrico Palermo outlines future cooperation in areas like deep space exploration and climate monitoring. He emphasizes the mutual benefits and challenges of this strategic alliance, aiming to enhance regional cooperation and technological advancement.
title: Australia looks beyond Gaganyaan and Moon for space collaboration with India

text: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore have been in space for nearly four months. Williams misses her dogs and New England's autumn foliage, while Wilmore regrets missing key moments in his daughters' lives. Despite these challenges, Williams finds joy in journaling about their unique experiences on the International Space Station.
title: “I miss my two dogs”: Sunita Williams talks about on earthly pleasures and life in orbit

text: According to a study published in The Lancet, antibiotic-resistant infections could result in over 39 million deaths globally within the next 25 years. This increasing threat is driven by the overuse of antibiotics. Researchers call for urgent strategies like vaccines, new drugs, and improved healthcare practices to mitigate this public health risk.
title: Superbugs death toll could swell by millions over coming years

text: UC Santa Barbara researchers have developed the first map of a human brain during pregnancy, showing significant changes in gray and white matter. This study reveals the brain's remarkable adaptability and may help understand postpartum depression. The findings challenge traditional views on women's fragility during pregnancy, offering new insights into neuroplasticity.
title: Researchers discover changes in the brain throughout pregnancy

text: The article features captivating space images of Earth's natural beauty and disasters. Highlights include photos of the Northern Lights over Norway, Sahara desert's patterns, Great Barrier Reef's vibrant corals, and Himalayas' peaks. Disasters like Hawaii wildfires, Hurricane Idalia's impact, Turkey earthquake damage, and Libya flooding are also documented.
title: 9/11 attacks, Northern lights & other marvels captured from space

text: The international day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer is observed on September 16, with India participating since 1995. The theme for World Ozone Day 2024 is “Montreal Protocol: Advancing Climate Actions.” This highlights the protocol's role in protecting the ozone layer and advancing climate action by phasing out harmful substances like CFCs and HCFCs.
title: World ozone day 2024: Origin, significance, and path to recovery

text: A team at Nagoya University Graduate School of Medicine has found that the enzyme protein kinase N (PKN) plays a role in cardiac fibrosis linked to heart failure. In mice models, deleting PKN reduced ventricular dysfunction and tissue buildup. These findings suggest that anti-PKN therapies could potentially protect against heart failure. The research was published in Nature Communications.
title: Study finds new target for treating heart failure

text: Researcher Sasha Luccioni highlights the significant energy consumption of generative AI compared to traditional search engines. Technologies like ChatGPT require vast computing power, contributing to higher greenhouse gas emissions. She advocates for transparency and energy efficiency in AI development, urging governments and companies to make informed decisions to mitigate the technology's environmental impact.
title: AI is 'accelerating the climate crisis,' expert warns

text: From September 29 to November 25, Earth will temporarily capture a new mini-moon named asteroid 2024 PT5. This small asteroid, about 10 meters wide and discovered by the Asteroid Terrestrial-Impact Last Alert System, will orbit Earth once before continuing its journey through space. These events underscore Earth's ongoing interactions with Near-Earth Objects.
title: Earth to get second 'mini-moon': Here's what you need to know

text: Iran launched the Chamran-1 research satellite into orbit using a rocket developed by the Revolutionary Guard. The satellite aims to test space hardware and software. This is Iran's second launch this year, raising Western concerns about potential ballistic missile development, which Iran denies. The launch coincides with heightened regional tensions.
title: Iran successfully launches research satellite, sparks Western concerns

text: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore shared their relief after the Boeing Starliner spacecraft safely landed in New Mexico. During a live press conference from the ISS, they discussed their extended mission, lessons learned, and upcoming handover to Expedition 72 astronauts Nick and Alex. The astronauts are scheduled to return to Earth aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon in February.
title: 'Lessons learned': Stranded astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore on Boeing's return to earth

text: MIT's new research reveals that AI chatbots can effectively reduce belief in conspiracy theories. In a study with over 2,000 participants, around 20% showed diminished belief after factual discussions with chatbots. This effect lasted for at least two months, suggesting a promising approach to combat misinformation and restore trust in public institutions.
title: Can AI talk us out of conspiracy theory rabbit holes?

text: Boeing's Starliner capsule completed its mission with a successful landing in New Mexico, despite numerous technical issues. Initially meant to return NASA astronauts from the ISS, safety concerns prompted their return on a SpaceX Crew Dragon in 2025. The mission provided valuable insights but highlighted ongoing challenges for Boeing.
title: Nasa explains why keeping Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore off Starliner was the 'right decision'

text: Scientists traced an unusual seismic signal from last September to a significant landslide in East Greenland's Dickson Fjord. The collapse of a mountain sent part of a glacier into the water, causing a 200-meter-high mega-tsunami that lasted nine days. This incident highlights the influence of climate change on geological phenomena.
title: Greenland landslide causes 9-day earthquake-like tremors: Study
Billionaire aboard SpaceX Dragon carries out first commercial spacewalk
Breathtaking cosmic catwalk! SpaceX makes history with first-ever private spacewalk

text: Private astronauts on the Polaris Dawn mission will undertake the first private spacewalk from a SpaceX capsule to evaluate new spacesuits. Led by billionaire Jared Isaacman, the crew includes a retired military pilot and two SpaceX employees. This mission aims to push commercial spaceflight boundaries and conduct scientific research on human responses in deep space.
title: SpaceX Polaris Dawn crew prepares for historic private spacewalk: How will it work?

text: The Soyuz MS-26 spacecraft launched from Moscow at 7:23 pm, carrying two Russian cosmonauts and one American astronaut to the International Space Station. It transports crew members and essential supplies while serving as an emergency escape pod. The spacecraft consists of three modules designed for living quarters, reentry, and life support systems.
title: Soyuz spacecraft carrying two Russians and an American launches for ISS

text: Manu Bhaker from Haryana won two bronze medals at the Paris Olympics in women's and mixed 10 metre air pistol events. The 22-year-old is now aiming for gold at the Los Angeles Olympics. Supported by coach Jaspal Rana, her family, and teammates, Manu turned Tokyo's disappointment into motivation for her recent success.
title: My sights set on hitting the bullseye at 2028 Olympics: Manu Bhaker

text: India's cricket team, led by Rohit Sharma, is focused on winning the World Test Championship (WTC) to complete their trophy collection. As part of the WTC cycle, they play a two-match Test series against Bangladesh. text: Rahul Dravid's stellar performances against Australia, especially his 233 and unbeaten 72 in the 2003 Adelaide Test, highlight his resilience and technique. These innings were pivotal in India's historic victory on Australian soil. Dravid's ability to perform under pressure earned him great respect from Australian players and fans alike. The match is often remembered for Dravid's remarkable batting and India's historic victory.

text: At age 38, Ravichandran Ashwin is preparing for what might be his last Test match at Chennai's MA Chidambaram ground against Bangladesh. Currently holding 516 Test wickets, he aims to surpass Anil Kumble's record of 619. Given his knee issues and India's home schedule, this could be his final appearance at this historic venue.

text: In a historic Champions League match, Bayern Munich triumphed over Dinamo Zagreb with a 9-2 scoreline. Harry Kane netted four goals, including three penalties. Additional goals were scored by Michael Olise, Raphael Guerreiro, Leroy Sane, and Leon Goretzka. Despite Manuel Neuer's injury, Bayern achieved their record-breaking win.
title: CL: Harry Kane scores four as Bayern put nine past Zagreb

text: Head coach Gautam Gambhir will lead Team India in his first Test assignment against Bangladesh after a difficult ODI series loss to Sri Lanka. The squad, with new bowling coach Morne Morkel, is training in Chennai. title: 'I know Gambhir...': Rohit on his understanding with India head coach

text: Rohit Sharma's Indian cricket team is set to begin a demanding Test schedule against Bangladesh in Chennai. Strategies are in place to manage the workload of key bowlers like Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj. After facing Bangladesh, India will play New Zealand at home before heading to Australia for a five-match Test series.

text: India secured their fifth Asian Champions Trophy title with a narrow 1-0 win against China in Hulunbuir. Jugraj Singh scored the decisive goal in the 51st minute after a tightly contested match. Despite China's resilient defense, India's persistence paid off in the final quarter. Pakistan finished third by defeating Korea 5-2 earlier in the tournament.
title: Jugraj's late strike hands India record fifth Asian Champions Trophy title

text: India and Bangladesh are adjusting their training strategies in Chennai for the first Test of the two-match series starting Thursday. The hot weather could impact pitch conditions, affecting team decisions on player selection.

text: The 1932–33 Bodyline series between England and Australia is remembered for its controversial tactics. Under skipper Douglas Jardine, England's bowlers targeted Australian batsmen with short-pitched balls aimed at their bodies. Despite winning the series 4–1, this approach caused injuries, public outrage in Australia, strained diplomatic relations, and led to changes in cricket rules.

text: India's men's hockey team secured a record-extending fifth Asian Champions Trophy title with a 1-0 victory over China, thanks to Jugraj Singh's late goal. text: Indian Railways' AI chatbot, AskDisha 2.0, powered by CoRover.AI, offers a range of services like booking tickets, refunds, checking PNR status, cancelling tickets, changing boarding station, checking booking history, and accessing e-tickets via text or voice commands in multiple languages.

text: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) has reclaimed a spot in the list of the world’s 10 most valuable companies, riding the optimism of the artificial intelligence (AI) boom. Analysts expect TSMC to further advance amid surging AI-related revenue and strong pricing power.

text: Google Maps is updating its Fused Orientation Provider (FOP) API to improve direction accuracy in busy areas. The update combines gyroscope, accelerometer, and magnetometer data, reducing magnetic interference and benefiting Google Maps and third-party apps on Android 5.0 or above.

text: IBM has further expanded its FinOps portfolio by acquiring Kubecost, a leading startup in Kubernetes cost management. This acquisition follows IBM's significant investment in Apptio in 2023. text: Manu Bhaker from Haryana won two bronze medals at the Paris Olympics in women's and mixed 10 metre air pistol events. The 22-year-old is now aiming for gold at the Los Angeles Olympics. text: Intel is transforming its foundry business into an independent subsidiary to enhance competitiveness in the semiconductor sector. CEO Pat Gelsinger revealed a significant agreement with AWS, while pausing new chip plant constructions in Germany and Poland. Intel will also divest part of its stake in Altera and significantly reduce its global real estate holdings.

text: The opposition INDIA bloc, comprising Congress, DMK, and communist parties, has declared a bandh in Puducherry on Wednesday to protest against the AINRC-BJP government's increased power tariffs. They argue that pre-paid meters and privatizing power distribution will harm farmers and result in unfair pricing. Former chief minister V Narayanasamy warned of further protests if demands are not met.
title: Why INDIA bloc has called for bandh in Puducherry

text: Moo Deng, a month-old baby pygmy hippo born at Khao Kheow Open Zoo in Thailand, has captured global attention. Pygmy hippos are native to West Africa and are considered endangered due to habitat loss and hunting. The zoo has experienced a significant increase in visitors since her birth. Know more about Moo Deng.

text: David Lochridge, a former OceanGate employee, testified that the Titan submersible tragedy might have been avoided if his safety warnings had been investigated. He expressed disappointment with OSHA's lack of action. ​The Titan submersible disappeared on 18 June 2023, after losing communication with its support ship following its descent about 400 miles off the coast of Newfoundland, Canada.
title: Titan submersible tragedy could have been averted? Key employee's big claim

text: The Supreme Court collegium has revised its July 11 recommendations for appointing chief justices to seven high courts following sensitive information from the Union government. Justices Suresh Kumar Kait, G S Sandhawalia, and Tashi Rabstan have been reassigned to different high courts. The other recommendations made on July 11 remain unchanged.
title: Postings of 3 HC CJs-designate changed on govt 'sensitive info'

text: The Supreme Court voiced concern over a CBI report highlighting serious flaws in how Kolkata Police handled evidence in the RG Kar Hospital rape and murder case. The court assured that justice would be pursued, with CBI investigating possible tampering and additional suspects. Senior doctors linked the crime to financial irregularities.
title: We're 'disturbed' by findings of CBI's RG Kar report: SC

text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced that the Waqf Amendment Bill, designed for managing and protecting Waqf properties, will soon be introduced in Parliament despite facing opposition. He also confirmed plans to resume the census process and implement 'one nation-one election' within the current government term.
title: Census process to resume 'very soon', confirms Amit Shah

text: Microsoft disclosed that a video falsely alleging Kamala Harris was involved in a hit-and-run is Russian propaganda. The video, shared by a fabricated news channel, seeks to influence US public opinion ahead of the presidential election. This demonstrates continued foreign efforts to manipulate American political views.
title: Fake Kamala hit-and-run story work of Russian group: Microsoft

text: Finance and education minister Atishi has been chosen as the new leader of AAP's legislative party, making her Delhi's eighth chief minister. Outgoing CM Arvind Kejriwal resigned following his release from jail. Atishi will lead until the assembly elections scheduled for February 2025, continuing Kejriwal's vision for Delhi.
title: Delhi gets its 3rd woman CM as Arvind Kejriwal hands charge to Atishi

text: Bangladesh's interim government announced that former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina is residing in India after her diplomatic passport was revoked. Her attempts to seek asylum elsewhere have been unsuccessful. Additionally, the government has granted magistracy powers to army officers for two months due to slow progress in improving law and order.
title: Dhaka on Hasina's stay in Delhi: 'Everything doesn't go by law'

text: Manoj Kumar Verma, a 1998-batch IPS officer known for handling crises, has taken over as Kolkata Police commissioner from Vineet Goyal. This move follows CM Mamata Banerjee's discussions with junior doctors protesting the RG Kar hospital rape-murder case. Other key officials were also replaced to meet the doctors' demands.
title: Didi picks Left-TMC's 'go-to man' as Kolkata Police boss

text: Anjali Tatrari shares her experiences playing Yuvika in Vanshaj as the show concludes. She discusses learning resilience from her character and highlights emotional scenes as her strength. Anjali expresses a desire to explore more challenging roles, including negative characters and action, and plans to move towards OTT platforms for broader career opportunities.
title: Anjali Tatrari talks about exploring new characters after Vanshaj

text: India's trade deficit nearly reached a record high in August with total imports rising to $64.4 billion due to a surge in gold shipments, while exports fell to $34.7 billion. Commerce Secretary Sunil Barthwal attributed this increase to higher prices and festival season stocking, considering these figures normal for an emerging market economy.
title: Trade deficit close to all-time high, thanks to record imports

text: PM Modi's three-day visit to the US starts on Sept 21 with his participation in the Quad Summit hosted by President Biden. He will address the UNGA Summit of the Future on Sept 23 and meet with US-based CEOs and Indian community members to enhance collaborations in advanced technologies such as AI, quantum computing, semiconductors, and biotechnology.
title: Quad, UNGA, bilaterals: Govt details PM's US visit itinerary

text: Dooru in Anantnag district, renowned for its literary heritage, is now politically significant as J&K prepares for assembly elections after a decade. AICC general secretary Ghulam Ahmad Mir of the NC-Congress alliance faces competition from PDP's Mohammad Ashraf Malik and Independents. The increased electorate of 116,749 voters may impact the election outcome.
title: Land of poets and storytellers gets ready to turn over a new leaf

text: Rohit Sharma's Indian cricket team is set to begin a demanding Test schedule against Bangladesh in Chennai. After facing Bangladesh, India will play New Zealand at home before heading to Australia for a five-match Test series.

text: Lieutenant Governor V K Saxena announced the resumption of land mutation based on inheritance for agricultural land in over 174 urban villages in Delhi. The process begins with camps set up in villages starting Friday. This decision impacts lakhs of residents who were denied this right since 2010 due to urbanization.
title: Delhi LG: Mutation of land in urban villages open, move to benefit lakhs

text: Donald Trump revealed plans to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi next week amid Modi's US visit for the Quad Leaders summit and the United Nations General Assembly. The two leaders shared a close bond during Trump's presidency, marked by major events like rallies in India and the US.
title: Donald Trump says he will meet PM Modi next week

text: Hundreds of Hezbollah members, including fighters and medical personnel, were severely injured when their communication pagers exploded across Lebanon. Described as the biggest security breach in almost a year of conflict with Israel, ambulances rushed through Beirut's southern suburbs amidst chaos. Ongoing detonations and numerous injuries were reported by local sources.
title: 9 killed, over 2,700 hurt after 1000s of pagers explode across Lebanon

text: Congress's manifesto for the upcoming J&K elections omits any mention of Article 370, a notable shift from its earlier stance against its abrogation. Instead, the party emphasizes securing statehood for J&K. Meanwhile, ally National Conference pledges to restore Article 370 and facilitate the dignified return of Kashmiri pandits.
title: Congress manifesto silent on Article 370 restoration

text: The 1932–33 Bodyline series between England and Australia is remembered for its controversial tactics. Under skipper Douglas Jardine, England's bowlers targeted Australian batsmen with short-pitched balls aimed at their bodies. Despite winning the series 4–1, this approach caused injuries, public outrage in Australia, strained diplomatic relations, and led to changes in cricket rules.

text: The Supreme Court has mandated that all state governments cease demolition activities until October 1 unless approved by the court. Highlighting concerns over the misuse of bulldozers as punitive measures, the court stressed the need for judicial oversight. Demolitions are permitted only for unauthorized constructions on public land.
title: SC halts bulldozer action without its nod till October 1

text: The Supreme Court has annulled criminal proceedings against 30 Army personnel implicated in a failed operation that killed 13 civilians in Nagaland's Mon district in 2021. The court highlighted that the Centre had refused to provide the necessary sanction under Section 6 of the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act, making the FIR unsustainable.
title: Botched Naga op: SC closes criminal cases against 30 Armymen

text: The Supreme Court took issue with a West Bengal health department advisory suggesting that women doctors work only 12-hour shifts and avoid night duties after a woman doctor's rape-murder. The court stressed equal opportunities and security for all professionals, urging the state to amend the circular in line with gender equality principles.
title: Will withdraw duty-hour curbs on women, WB says after SC rap

text: Resident doctors in New Delhi have agreed to resume duties after reaching an agreement with CM Mamata Banerjee. The Supreme Court has instructed the state to enhance security at government hospitals and establish safety audits, grievance redressal systems, and internal committees for handling sexual harassment complaints within two weeks.
title: Junior docs: Will resume duty once pact with Bengal CM implemented

text: Snap Inc introduced its fifth-generation AR spectacles at the Snap Partner Summit in Los Angeles. These lightweight glasses feature a new OS, hand gesture controls, and virtual console capabilities. Initially available to developers for $99 monthly, they promise advanced AR experiences with partnerships including OpenAI, Lego Games, and Niantic.
title: AR glasses are here: Snap launches spectacles at LA summit and its own OS to power it

text: Donald Trump accuses Democrats of inciting violence against him, citing recent assassination attempts as evidence. Democrats counter by highlighting Trump's own inflammatory rhetoric. Both sides use selective statements to support their claims. Security concerns for Trump have intensified, leading to calls for increased protection and investigations into the threats.

text: Kapil Sibal appealed to the Supreme Court to cease live streaming its suo motu proceedings on a sensitive rape-murder case, expressing concerns about reputational harm. Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud maintained that public transparency is crucial and assured protection for lawyers facing threats due to their involvement in the case.
title: To save reputations, Sibal opposes live-streaming, but SC rejects plea

text: The Supreme Court has granted bail to Sunil NS, known as Pulsar Suni, who is the main accused in the 2017 actor assault case involving actor Dileep. Arrested in February 2017, Suni's extended imprisonment and the anticipated lengthy trial process influenced the court's decision to release him on bail.

text: Vice President Kamala Harris called former President Donald Trump to express relief over his safety after a shooting near his Florida golf course. The FBI is investigating the incident as an attempted assassination. Suspect Ryan Wesley Routh faces firearm charges and remains in custody, with hearings scheduled for later this month.

text: The Uttarakhand forest department has established 42 ecological laboratories to monitor the impact of climate change on forests. These labs will collect data on changes like early flowering in rhododendrons and Brahmakamal, and the quality of litchis affected by high temperatures. This data is essential for understanding and mitigating climate change effects.
title: Uttarakhand sets up 42 'forest labs' to study flora

text: Scientists traced an unusual seismic signal from last September to a significant landslide in East Greenland's Dickson Fjord. This incident highlights the influence of climate change on geological phenomena.

text: From late Thursday into early Friday, solar storms are expected to create faint auroras visible in Canada and northern US states including Alaska and Washington. text: A recent Reddit post by an employee has gone viral, revealing her dismissal from a mental health startup after she liked a LinkedIn post criticizing toxic workplaces. text: Explosives embedded in over 5000 pagers by Mossad triggered simultaneous explosions across Lebanon, causing over 11 deaths and injuring more than 3000 people. text: PM Modi-led Union Cabinet has approved major space missions: Chandrayaan-4 for lunar sample return, Bharatiya Antariksh Station by 2035, and a Venus Orbiter Mission. text: A partial lunar eclipse named Chandra Grahan is set for September 18, 2024. Visible in North America, Europe, Africa, and South America but not in India due to the Moon being below the horizon. The event can be watched safely with the naked eye or via live streams from NASA and ESA.

text: Using the James Webb Space Telescope, astronomers have confirmed that supermassive black holes can prevent star formation in their host galaxies by expelling vital gas and dust. text: Australia and India are expanding their space collaboration, focusing on supporting India's Gaganyaan mission and launching joint satellites. text: According to a study published in The Lancet, antibiotic-resistant infections could result in over 39 million deaths globally within the next 25 years. This increasing threat is driven by the overuse of antibiotics. Researchers call for urgent strategies like vaccines, new drugs, and improved healthcare practices to mitigate this public health risk.

text: UC Santa Barbara researchers have developed the first map of a human brain during pregnancy, showing significant changes in gray and white matter. text: The international day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer is observed on September 16, with India participating since 1995. text: A team at Nagoya University Graduate School of Medicine has found that the enzyme protein kinase N (PKN) plays a role in cardiac fibrosis linked to heart failure. In mice models, deleting PKN reduced ventricular dysfunction and tissue buildup. These findings suggest that anti-PKN therapies could potentially protect against heart failure. text: Researcher Sasha Luccioni highlights the significant energy consumption of generative AI compared to traditional search engines. text: From September 29 to November 25, Earth will temporarily capture a new mini-moon named asteroid 2024 PT5. These events underscore Earth's ongoing interactions with Near-Earth Objects.

text: Iran launched the Chamran-1 research satellite into orbit using a rocket developed by the Revolutionary Guard. The satellite aims to test space hardware and software. text: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore shared their relief after the Boeing Starliner spacecraft safely landed in New Mexico. text: MIT's new research reveals that AI chatbots can effectively reduce belief in conspiracy theories. text: Boeing's Starliner capsule completed its mission with a successful landing in New Mexico, despite numerous technical issues.
